title: Circular Design: Rethinking Waste as a Design Failure
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Circular Design: Rethinking Waste as a Design Failure.

hook.text: In nature, there's no such thing as waste. Every output is an input for something else.

discovery.text: Cradle to Cradle design creates two types of materials: biological (compostable) and technical (infinitely recyclable).

twist.text: Patagonia's 'Don't Buy This Jacket' campaign encouraged repair over replacement.

climax.text: The EU's Right to Repair legislation now requires electronics to be repairable for 10 years.

punchline.text: Waste isn't inevitable. It's a design choice. And we can choose differently.
